intro: Eriospermum macrum, commonly known as the woolly eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, hairy stems and fleshy, orb-shaped leaves that help it retain moisture in arid conditions. Its flowers are typically small and yellow, appearing in clusters at the ends of the stems. Eriospermum macrum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
